IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO ASSIST THE FDNY IN ITS MISSION TO PREVENT AND RESPOND TO FIRES, MEDICAL EMERGENICES, DISASTER AND TERRORIST ACTS, PROTECTING THE LIVES AND PROPERTY OF RESIDENTS AND VISITORS IN NEW YORK CITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The FDNY Foundation is the official 501(c)(3) non-profit organization to benefit the New York City Fire Department. The funds raised assist the FDNY in its mission to prevent and respond to fires, medical emergencies, disasters and terrorist acts, protecting the lives and property of residents and visitors in New York City. The FDNY Foundation funds programs to help meet the Department's training, equipment, and education needs.
IRS990.Description: FIREZONE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM: THE FDNY FIREZONE IS A STATE-OF-THE ART LEARNING CENTER LOCATED IN ROCKEFELLER CENTER OFFERING FIRE SAFETY AND PREVENTION INSTRUCTION FROM AN EDUCATOR TO NYC RESIDENTS AND VISITORS. THE FACILITY ALLOWS YOUNG PEOPLE AND ADULTS TO EXPERIENCE THE DANGERS OF FIRE AND RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF FIRE PREVENTION. TO DATE THERE HAVE BEEN OVER ONE MILLION VISITORS.

Activity2.Description: FIREZONE RETAIL STORE: THE RETAIL STORE IS LOCATED IN THE HEART OF ROCKEFELLER CENTER AND OFFERS OFFICIAL LICENSED FDNY MERCHANDISE THAT PROMOTES THE MESSAGE OF FIRE SAFETY ENABLING THE FOUNDATION TO SUSTAIN THE DEPARTMENT'S FIRE SAFETY EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THE PROCEEDS FROM THE SALES OF MERCHANDISE ENABLES THE FOUNDATION TO SUSTAIN THE DEPARTMENT'S FIRE SAFETY EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

Activity3.Description: COUNSELING AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS: THESE PROGRAMS HELP MEET THE NEEDS OF FIREFIGHTERS AND THEIR FAMILIES IMPACTED BY SICKNESS, TRAGEDY AND OTHER CHALLENGES. THE FIRE SAFETY EDUCATION UNIT PROMOTES FIRE SAFETY AND PREVENTION AT SCHOOLS, SENIOR CENTERS, COMMUNITY BOARD AND NEIGHBORHOOD GROUPS THROUGHOUT THE CITY. FIRE SAFETY LITERATURE IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THESE PRESENTATIONS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF BOARD DESIGNATED FUNDS ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING FOR THE FOUNDATION'S PROGRAMS.

IN 2009, THE FOUNDATION ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION ("ASC") 740-10-05 RELATING TO ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. FOR THE FOUNDATION, THESE PROVISIONS COULD BE APPLICABLE TO THE INCURRENCE OF UNRELATED BUSINES INCOME TAX (UBIT) ATTRIBUTABLE TO CERTAIN OF THE ORGANIZATION'S INVESTMENTS. BECAUSE OF THE FOUNDATION'S GENERAL TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, ASC 740-10-05 HAS NOT HAD, AND IS NOT ANTICIPATED TO HAVE, A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION MONITORS GRANTS AWARDED TO THE NEW YORK CITY FIRE DEPARTMENT THROUGH WRITTEN AND ORAL PRESENTATIONS AT QUARTERLY BOARD MEETINGS WITH PROGRESS, EVENT AND EXPENSE REPORTS IN CONNECTION WITH VARIOUS PROGRAMS. FUND ALLOCATION DETAILS ARE PROVIDED BY THE RECIPIENT DEPARTMENT HEAD ALONG WITH REGULAR WRITTEN AND VERBAL UPDATES ON PROGRESS. INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS MUST SUBMIT PROOF OF TUITION DOCUMENTATION BEFORE SCHOLARSHIPS FUNDS ARE DISBURSED.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE VARIOUS PROGRAMS SUPPORTING FIRE SAFETY AND FIRE PREVENTION, AS WELL AS, DIRECT SUPPORT OF THE NEW YORK CITY FIRE DEPARTMENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TWO MEMBERS OF THE FDNY FOUNDATION BOARD ARE ALWAYS THE FIRE COMMISSIONER AND THE CHIEF OF DEPARTMENT. THE FIRE COMMISSIONER AND CHIEF OF DEPARTMENT SERVE AS EX-OFFICIO BOARD MEMBERS AND RETAIN BOARD MEMBERS DURING TERMS OF THEIR OFFICES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT, AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A DRAFT COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS FIRST REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. THE REVISED DRAFT IS GIVEN TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND QUESTIONS. AFTER ALL CHANGES HAVE BEEN ADDRESSED, THE FINAL 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD BEFORE FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT, AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: BOARD MEMBERS AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF ARE REQUIRED TO ATTEST ANNUALLY TO THEIR FAMILIARITY WITH THE FOUNDATION'S POLICIES AND PROVIDE INFORMATION CONCERNING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FDNY FOUNDATION PROCESS FOR DETERMINING EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS TO REVIEW COMPARABLE SALARIES IN OTHER NOT FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, USE VARIOUS POSTINGS SUCH AS THE CHRONICLE OF PHILANTHROPY AND THE CITY GUIDE IN SALARY SCALES AND ALSO USE THE PROFESSIONALS FOR NON PROFIT SALARY RANGE. ALL COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PART VI, GOVERNANCE, MANAGEMENT AND DISCLOSURE, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
APPLICATION OF TIME TO FILE FOR AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, FORM 8868, WAS PAPER FILED.
